data.event: Salado was first incorporated in 1867 for the sole purpose of building a bridge across Salado Creek.
In 2000 the citizens of Salado voted in favor of re-incorporation, before which point it was a census-designated place (CDP).

The first record of white settlers in the area occurs in 1834 however by 1836 the pioneer settlers abandoned area due to frequent Indian attacks and the invasion by General Santa Anna and the Mexican Army.

event.title: 1852, the Salado Post Office was established

data.event: In 1852, the Salado Post Office was established.

event.title: 1859, the Salado College Joint Stock Company was created

data.event: In 1859, the Salado College Joint Stock Company was created by Col. Elijah Sterling Clack Robertson who donated 320 acres north and south of the springs to be broken into lots and form the village of Salado.
